thread.title: St Etienne vs Manchester United LIVE score and goal updates from the Europa League second leg
thread.title_full: St Etienne vs Manchester United LIVE score and goal updates from the Europa League second leg

author: Rory Brigstock-Barron
title: St Etienne vs Manchester United LIVE score and goal updates from the Europa League second leg
text:
Sport St Etienne vs Manchester United LIVE score and goal updates from the Europa League second leg Jose Mourhino's side take a 3-0 advantage to France as they look to seal their place in the last 16 Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Saint-Etienne v Man Utd: Europa League match preview Share this video Watch Next 
St Etienne have it all to do against Manchester United as they look to overturn a 3-0 deficit from the first leg at Old Trafford six days ago. 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic's hat-trick has given Jose Mourinho's side a comfortable cushion over the Ligue 1 side and they'll be looking to snuff out the French side's challenge with Sunday's EFL Cup final against Southampton on the horizon. 
Luke Shaw and Wayne Rooney are notable absences for United who have taken a strong squad to France. 
Manchester United squad : De Gea, O'Hara, Romero; Bailly, Blind, Fosu-Mensah, Rojo, Smalling, Valencia, Young; Carrick, Fellaini, Mata, Mkhitaryan, Pogba, Lingard, Schweinsteiger; Ibrahimovic, Martial, Rashford Key Events 15:12 No Luke Shaw tonight... here's why 
Luke Shaw has been told by Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho that he is FOURTH choice left-back . 
The 21-year-old, who signed from Southampton for £27m in 201 has found regular game time under the Portuguese manager very hard to come by since returning from a nasty leg break. 
He as was an unused substitute at Ewood Park for the FA Cup fifth round victory over Blackburn and didn’t even travel as part of the 20-man squad to face Saint-Etienne in France for the second leg of the Europa League last 32 tie. Shaw has been restricted to appearances in the cup competitions (Photo: Rex Features) 14:55 
HERE are 11 things you need to know... Manchester United's Zlatan Ibrahimovic applauds the fans (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 14:44 
United already set their stall out in the first leg. 
But they’re doing it again in St Etienne... Man United fans in Saint-Etienne (Photo: REUTERS) 14:39 
St Etienne fans brought flares to Manchester and the Red Devils have returned the favour... 14:22 Martial explains poor form 
Anthony Martial revealed his lack of game time is the reason for his dip in form. 
The Manchester United star has struggled to cement a first-team place in the team this season and has made just 10 starts in the Premier League. 
But despite pointing a finger at his lack of opportunity in the starting XI, the Frenchman stopped short of blaming boss Jose Mourinho. 
See what he had to say HERE . Manchester United's Anthony Martial during yesterday's press conference (Photo: REUTERS) 14:13 14:05 Why Wednesday? 
Manchester United will get an extra day to prepare for their EFL Cup final clash with Southampton because of a rare Wednesday night Europa League fixture. 
But it’s not the Wembley date that has forced their second leg with French side St Etienne to take place earlier. 
Find out why HERE . Paul Pogba and Jose Mourinho in training on Tuesday (Photo: PA) 13:59 But it's my birthday... 
Sergio Romero is hoping to usurp David de Gea tonight on his 30th birthday. 
The Argentine has often been used by Mourinho in cup competitions and could be in with a good chance tonight given Sunday’s looming EFL Cup final. 13:51 Welcome! 
Hello and welcome to the build up to this exceedingly early Europa League game. 
Kick-off is at 5pm on a Wednesday at the Stade Geoffroy-Guichard as Manchester United defend a 3-0 lead from the first leg. 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic netted a hat-trick six days ago at Old Trafford to leave the Ligue 1 side facing an uphill battle. 
But with United having one eye on Sunday’s EFL Cup final with Southampton, what will Jose Mourinho’s team look like? 
Here are our predicted line-ups for the tonight’s clash: 
Saint-Etienne: Ruffier, Malcuit, Perrin, Theophile-Catherine, Pogba, Jorginho, Veretout, Pajot, Monnet-Paquet, Saivet, Hamouma 
Man United: De Gea, Valencia, Smalling, Bailly, Blind, Pogba, Fellaini, Mata, Mkhitaryan, Rashford, Ibrahimovic Share
